Christoph Spielmann wrote:

> I just had the meeting with my professor about our
> project. The state is the following: Heritrix is not
> running with SP2.
>
> When i start crawling a job: it discoveres 2 documents
> and queus 4. That's it! All  the other logs are empty
> (during the crawl).
>
> But in the Frontier report there was one entry that
> there was one document in the queue that was snoozing.
> I was waiting till the "Wakes in:"-timer went down to
> 0. The result was that the whole crawljob was marked
> as finished and in the crawl.log i got the following
> output:
>
> 20050224174047675    -6          - dns:www.cp.jku.at P
> http://www.cp.jku.at/ no-type #001 30024 - 2t
> 20050224175547709    -6          -
> http://www.cp.jku.at/ - - no-type #001 - - 2t
>
> i read in the manual that the -6 status code is
> returned, when the dns-lookup fails. So i thought that
> this might be connected with the dnsjava-dependency.
> Looking into the readme of dnsjava i found the
> following statement:
>
> If the underlying OS is Windows, winipcfg/ipconfig can
> be called and the output parsed.  Note that this may
> fail for non-English versions of Windows.
>
> I'm using the english version of windows on my comp
> and on the other computer i tried to run heritrix at
> home. The prof has the german version of windows xp,
> so i guess that's what causing all the troubles with
> heritrix.

>
> So now my question is how can this problem be solved??
>
Take a look at this issue:

https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&atid=539099&aid=1149470&group_id=73833

It looks like your problem.  I'm waiting on a sample of what dns records 
that do not match our expression look like.  Maybe you can supply them, 
if the problem's the same (I'm guessing that parsing of a german 
winipcfg/ipconfig is not the problem).

Yours,
St.Ack


> Regards,
>
> Christoph
